qas.question: In 2006 what percent of the population was impacted by crime?

context: In 2006, crime in Santa Monica affected <a0_0><b6_0>4.41%<b6_0/><a0_0/> of the population, slightly lower than the national average crime rate that year of <b7_0>4.48%<b7_0/>. The majority of this was <a1_0>property<a1_0/> crime, which affected <a2_0>3.74%<a2_0/> of Santa Monica's population in <b5_0>2006<b5_0/>; this was higher than the rates for Los Angeles County (2.76%) and California (3.17%), but lower than the national average (3.91%). These per-capita crime rates are <a3_0>computed based<a3_0/> on Santa Monica's full-time population of about 85,000. However, the Santa Monica Police Department has suggested the actual per-capita crime rate is <a4_0>much lower<a4_0/>, as tourists, workers, and beachgoers can increase the city's daytime population to between <b8_0>250,000<b8_0/> and <b9_0>450,000<b9_0/> people.
